title: MRI: Magnets That See Inside You
description: One-minute skill: MRI: Magnets That See Inside You.

hook.text: An MRI machine uses magnets 60,000 times stronger than Earth's field to see inside your body.

buildup.text: MRI stands for magnetic resonance imaging. It detects hydrogen atoms in your body.

discovery.text: A powerful magnet aligns hydrogen protons. Radio pulses knock them out of alignment briefly.

twist.text: As protons realign, they emit signals. Different tissues realign at different speeds â€” creating contrast.

climax.text: MRI produces detailed images of soft tissue â€” brain, organs, joints â€” without any radiation.

punchline.text: MRI sees inside you using magnets and radio waves. No X-rays, no surgery, no cutting.

quiz.question: What does an MRI machine detect in the body?
options: Hydrogen atoms responding to magnetic fields
